results.adx_keywords: Aviation Accidents, Safety and Disasters;Airlines and Airplanes;Air Shows and Air Racing;Military Aircraft;Wings Over Dallas;Dallas (Tex)
results.byline: By Margarita Birnbaum and Vimal Patel
results.title: Two Planes Collide in Midair at Dallas Air Show, F.A.A. Says
results.abstract: The crash involved two World War II-era planes at an air show in Dallas with as many as six people on board, though officials as of Saturday night had not yet confirmed casualties.

results.adx_keywords: Weddings and Engagements;Hurricane Nicole (2022);Maples, Marla;Trump, Donald J;Trump, Tiffany (1993- );Mar-a-Lago (Palm Beach, Fla);Florida
results.title: Tiffany Trump Weds at Mar-a-Lago
results.abstract: Tiffany Trump and Michael Boulos, whose wedding was almost derailed by Hurricane Nicole, treated their guests to an American-Lebanese celebration at her father’s private residence.

media.caption: Marla Maples, left, Michael Boulos, Tiffany Trump and former President Donald J. Trump at Mar-a-Lago on Saturday.

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);United States Politics and Government;Elections, Senate;Masto, Catherine Cortez;Kelly, Mark E (1964- );Senate;Democratic Party;Republican Party;Arizona;Nevada
results.title: Democrats Hold the Senate, as Cortez Masto Ekes Out a Victory in Nevada
results.abstract: Senator Catherine Cortez Masto defeated Adam Laxalt, the state’s former attorney general. Democrats now will try to add to their control of the chamber in Georgia’s runoff election on Dec. 6.

media.caption: Senator Catherine Cortez Masto at her election night party in Las Vegas. Days later, her victory over Adam Laxalt, a Republican former attorney general of Nevada, was confirmed.
media.copyright: Mikayla Whitmore for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Elections, Senate;Midterm Elections (2022);United States Politics and Government;Kelly, Mark E (1964- );Masters, Blake (1986- );Democratic Party;Republican Party;Arizona
results.title: Mark Kelly Wins Arizona Senate Race, Putting Democrats a Seat From Control
results.abstract: Mr. Kelly, who ran as a bipartisan legislator devoted to the needs of Arizona, defeated Blake Masters, a Republican newcomer whose ideological fervor failed to win over enough independent voters.

media.caption: Senator Mark Kelly of Arizona celebrated his re-election with his wife, former Representative Gabby Giffords, at Barrio Cafe in Phoenix on Saturday.
media.copyright: Caitlin O'Hara for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Hair;Content Type: Service;Skin;Women and Girls;Polycystic Ovary Syndrome;Face
results.title: Why Do Women Sprout Chin Hairs as They Age?
results.abstract: And what’s the best way to remove them?

media.copyright: Aileen Son for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Elections, Senate;Masto, Catherine Cortez;Laxalt, Adam;Democratic Party;Clark County (Nev)
results.title: Mail Ballots Around Las Vegas Are Likely to Put Democrats Ahead
results.abstract: Senator Catherine Cortez Masto is within 1,000 votes of overtaking her Republican opponent, Adam Laxalt, and the ballots remaining in Clark County are expected to favor her.

media.caption: An election worker inspected a mail-in ballot in the count room at the Clark County Election Department in North Las Vegas, Nev., on Saturday.
media.copyright: Steve Marcus/Las Vegas Sun, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Pop and Rock Music;Parker, Mimi (1967-2022);Sparhawk, Alan;Sub Pop Records;Low (Music Group)
results.title: Mimi Parker, Moody Alt-Rock Vocalist, Is Dead at 55
results.abstract: Her influential band, Low, emerged in the 1990s, but its minimalist sound stood in sharp contrast to the anthems of angst that came to define the grunge era.

media.caption: Mimi Parker of Low in performance in Paris in 2011. The band, which she founded with her husband, Alan Sparhawk, remained an influential and acclaimed act for nearly 30 years.

results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);Comedy and Humor;Television;Nineteen Hundred Eighties;Gallagher (Comedian)
results.title: Gallagher, Watermelon-Smashing Comedian, Is Dead at 76
results.abstract: He called himself “The Wizard of Odd” for his outrageous stage act, making him one of the most recognizable comedians of the 1980s.

media.caption: Gallagher in 1985. He said it was his job to “yell at the world.”

results.adx_keywords: Robberies and Thefts;Bicycles and Bicycling;Police;Police Reform
results.byline: By Michael Corkery and Andres Kudacki
results.title: The Bike Thieves of Burlington, Vermont
results.abstract: A hunt for stolen goods has put citizens and business owners in the center of a debate about policing and a growing, sometimes violent, problem with crime.

results.adx_keywords: Social Media;Rumors and Misinformation;Hoaxes and Pranks;Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures;Layoffs and Job Reductions;Musk, Elon;Twitter
results.byline: By Ryan Mac, Benjamin Mullin, Kate Conger and Mike Isaac
results.title: A Verifiable Mess: Twitter Users Create Havoc by Impersonating Brands
results.abstract: The social media service, which is undergoing changes from its new owner Elon Musk, has descended into a messy swirl of spoof messages and parody accounts.

media.copyright: Jason Henry for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Social Media;Online Advertising;Layoffs and Job Reductions;Computers and the Internet;Appointments and Executive Changes;Mergers, Acquisitions and Divestitures;Musk, Elon;Twitter
results.byline: By Kate Conger, Mike Isaac, Ryan Mac and Tiffany Hsu
results.title: Two Weeks of Chaos: Inside Elon Musk’s Takeover of Twitter
results.abstract: Mr. Musk ordered immediate layoffs, fired executives by email and laid down product deadlines, transforming the company.

results.adx_keywords: Child Labor;Meatpacking Plants and Slaughterhouses;Labor and Jobs;Hazardous and Toxic Substances;Workplace Hazards and Violations;Packer's Sanitation Services Inc Ltd;JBS SA;Turkey Valley Farms LLC;Labor Department (US);Nebraska;Wisconsin;Minnesota
results.title: Labor Department Finds 31 Children Cleaning Meatpacking Plants
results.abstract: Packers Sanitation Services, a food safety contractor, hired children as young as 13 to clean dangerous equipment on overnight shifts, the department said. Several suffered chemical burns.

media.caption: An image that the Labor Department included in paperwork seeking an injunction against Packers Sanitation Services showed a worker using a high-powered hose at a meatpacking plant in Worthington, Minn.

results.title: Biden Is No Sure Thing for 2024. What About Buttigieg? Harris? Even Whitmer?
results.abstract: Many Democrats have craved the chance to pick somebody else to run for president in 2024. But which somebody?

media.copyright: Illustration by The New York Times; Photograph by Brittany Greeson for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Espionage and Intelligence Services;Freedom of Information Act;Cyberattacks and Hackers;Classified Information and State Secrets;Cellular Telephones;Wray, Christopher A;Wyden, Ron;Federal Bureau of Investigation;Justice Department;NSO Group;Israel
results.byline: By Mark Mazzetti and Ronen Bergman
results.title: Internal Documents Show How Close the F.B.I. Came to Deploying Spyware
results.abstract: Christopher Wray, the F.B.I.’s director, told Congress last December that the bureau purchased the phone hacking tool Pegasus for research and development purposes.

media.caption: Christopher A. Wray, the F.B.I. director, acknowledged that the bureau considered deploying the hacking tool.
media.copyright: Stefani Reynolds for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);United States Politics and Government;Presidential Election of 2024;Trump, Donald J;DeSantis, Ron;Republican Party
results.title: The Emperor of Chaos Has No Clothes
results.abstract: Is this the end of Little Caesar? Or will Trump retain his G.O.P. domain?

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);United States Politics and Government;Elections, Senate;Elections, House of Representatives;Campaign Finance;Political Action Committees;Biden, Joseph R Jr;Dunn, Anita;Maloney, Sean Patrick;McCarthy, Kevin (1965- );McConnell, Mitch;McDaniel, Ronna Romney;Trump, Donald J;Democratic Party;ActBlue;Democratic Congressional Campaign Committee;Republican Party;Republican National Committee;WinRed
results.title: How the 2022 Midterms Became a Squeaker
results.abstract: Interviews with more than 70 current and former officials show the outside forces — and miscalculations and infighting — that led to an improbable, still-undecided election.

media.caption: Defying historical precedent, control of Congress remains too close to call days after the midterm elections.
media.copyright: T.J. Kirkpatrick for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Student Athlete Compensation;Social Media;Women and Girls;Gymnastics;Basketball (College);Advertising and Marketing;VanDerveer, Tara;Dunne, Olivia (2002- );Jones, Haley (2001- );Instagram Inc;TikTok (ByteDance);Louisiana State University;Stanford University
results.title: New Endorsements for College Athletes Resurface an Old Concern: Sex Sells
results.abstract: Female college athletes are making millions thanks to their large social media followings. But some who have fought for equity in women’s sports worry that their brand building is regressive.

media.caption: Olivia Dunne, a gymnast at Louisiana State, earns over $1 million annually in endorsements. “That is something I’m proud of,” she said, adding that most female athletes will not advance to a pro league after college.
media.copyright: Annie Flanagan for The New York Times

results.title: What Happened to FTX? Here’s What to Know.
results.abstract: Binance, the world’s largest cryptocurrency exchange, was set to bail out FTX. Then it pulled out of the deal.

media.caption: FTX appeared set for a bailout from Binance, but then the deal fell apart.

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Elections, Senate;Elections, Governors;Elections, Attorneys General;United States Politics and Government;Lake, Kari A;Masters, Blake (1986- );Kelly, Mark E (1964- );Hobbs, Kathleen M;Finchem, Mark W;Hamadeh, Abraham;Democratic Party;Republican Party;Arizona
results.byline: By Jazmine Ulloa and Jack Healy
results.title: Arizona’s Top Races Near the Finish in a Tension-Filled Battleground
results.abstract: Senator Mark Kelly, a Democrat, holds an edge in his bid for re-election, but the race for governor appears to be a true tossup, even as several Republican candidates sow doubts about the results.

media.caption: Ballots being processed this week at the Maricopa County Elections Center in Phoenix. All four of the state’s top races were uncalled as of midday Friday.
media.copyright: Alisha Jucevic for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Midterm Elections (2022);Elections, Senate;Elections, House of Representatives;Right-Wing Extremism and Alt-Right;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;McCarthy, Kevin (1965- );Republican Party
results.title: Republicans Reckon With Midterm Election Fallout
results.abstract: They may still win the House. But an underwhelming showing has the G.O.P. wrestling with what went wrong: Was it bad candidates, a bad message or Donald J. Trump?

media.caption: Former President Donald J. Trump held a rally in June outside Quincy, Ill. Candidates he endorsed lost the pivotal Senate race in Pennsylvania and key House and statewide races in Michigan, Ohio and North Carolina, among other places.
media.copyright: Jamie Kelter Davis for The New York Times
